name: Monica
description:
'''Monica Denise Arnold''' (formerly '''Brown'''; born October 24, 1980) is an American singer, rapper, songwriter, and actress. Born and raised in [[College Park, Georgia]], she began performing as a child and joined a traveling [[gospel choir]] by the age of ten. Monica signed with record producer [[Dallas Austin]]'s label [[Rowdy Records]] in 1993, and gained prominence following the release of her debut studio album, ''[[Miss Thang]]'' (1995). Her follow-up albums were met with continued success; her second, ''[[The Boy Is Mine (album)|The Boy Is Mine]] '' (1998) remains her best-selling album and spawned three [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]-number one singles: "[[The Boy Is Mine (Brandy and Monica song)|The Boy Is Mine]]" (with [[Brandy Norwood|Brandy]]), "[[The First Night]] " and "[[Angel of Mine#Monica version|Angel of Mine]]".

She then parted ways with [[Arista Records|Arista]] and [[Rowdy Records]] in favor of [[Clive Davis]]'s [[J Records]] upon the label's launch in 2000. Her Japan-exclusive third album, ''[[All Eyez on Me (Monica album)|All Eyez on Me]]'' (2002), was met with a steep critical and commercial decline, although its partial re-issue, ''[[After the Storm (Monica album)|After the Storm]]'' (2003), served as her fourth album and became her first to debut atop the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. Its lead single, "[[So Gone]]", peaked at number ten on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. Her fifth and sixth albums, ''[[The Makings of Me]]'' (2006) and ''[[Still Standing (Monica album)|Still Standing]]'' (2010), debuted at numbers eight and two on the ''Billboard'' 200, respectively; the latter received two [[Grammy Award]] nominations. Her seventh, ''[[New Life (Monica album)|New Life]]'' (2012) debuted at number four on the chart despite unfavorable critical response; her eighth album, ''[[Code Red (Monica album)|Code Red]]'' (2015) marked her final release with RCA.

Monica's popularity translated into an acting career, with television roles in ''[[Living Single]]'' (1996), ''[[Felicity (TV series)|Felicity]]'' (2001), and ''[[American Dreams]]'' (2003), and film roles including ''[[Boys and Girls (2000 film)|Boys and Girls]]'' (2000), ''[[Love Song (2000 film)|Love Song]]'' (2000), and ''[[Pastor Brown]]'' (2009). In 2008, she served as an advisor for the [[NBC]] competition series ''[[The Voice (U.S. TV series)|The Voice]]''. The recording of her 2008 single, "[[Still Standing (Monica song)|Still Standing]]" (featuring [[Ludacris]]) along with her personal life resulted in her receiving a reality television series, ''[[Monica: Still Standing]]'' on [[BET]].

Monica has sold more than five million albums in the United States. In 2010, ''[[Billboard magazine|Billboard]]'' listed Monica at number 24 on its list of the Top 50 R&B and Hip-Hop Artists of the past 25 years. A five-time nominee, she won [[Grammy Award for Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals|Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals]] for "The Boy Is Mine" at the [[41st Annual Grammy Awards]]. Her other accolades include a [[Billboard Music Award|''Billboard'' Music Video Award]], a [[BET Awards|BET Award]], and a [[Soul Train Music Award]]. Monica also received the Lady of Soul Honor in 2020.
